Description: Wooden comb; double-sided with coarse teeth on one side and fine on the other, carved and decorated with concentric circles; inlaid with bone; fragment, incomplete width
Curator's comments: Previously described as ebony and inlaid with bone; also believed to be Roman of the 3rd or 4th century AD at the time of original acquisition.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
Acquisition notes: Transferred from the Victoria and Albert Museum in 1977 under Bill of Sale 77/1872.
